results.title: Romantic ballads
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Three romantic ballads: 1. ‘Miss you’ by The Four Folks - instrumental and singing group. 2. ‘A Nightingale sang in Berkeley Square’ sung by Tamara with Del Casino Orchestra and girl dance group. 3. ‘It was wonderful then’ featuring Bob Hannon.

results.title: Romantic
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Orchestra Series”.
Part Four of the Orchestra series which describes the evolution of the modern symphony orchestra from its beginnings in the 17th century to the present. The centre-piece of this program is composer, innovator and orchestrator, Hector Berlioz. Jane Glover conducts the London Philharmonic Orchestra playing excerpts from Berlioz’s “Treatise on Orchestration”. The Romantic Movement, with its emphasis on “man’s free will”, brought about a radical shift in the composer’s use of the orchestra, changing its role to that of storyteller.

results.title: Romanov
results.creator_credit: Yuri Sokol, Sokol Films and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: The history of the influential royal Romanov family and their descendants search for identity are the subject of this SBS funded documentary. The tape covers present attitudes in Russia towards a monarchy, and follows the story of one Australian Romanov member who, with his wife, returns to Russia to research his heritage.

results.title: Romania
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated and Institut für Film und Bild
results.brief_description: Romania, for centuries an agricultural country whose people were mostly herdsmen, is now one of Eastern Europe’s most rapidly developing industrial nations. Surveys the country, its people geography and industry, and illustrates the changes taking place as the society progresses from rural to urban-industrial.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Films Incorporated and Institut für Film und Bild

results.title: Romanesque painters
results.creator_credit: L'Atelier du Film and Rene Marjac
results.brief_description: Describes the work of the 11th century Romanesque painters whose work covered the walls and ceilings of the churches in late mediaeval France, giving an account of the subjects depicted and the techniques used. Explains that the artists attempted to create a link of universal symbols between the world of God and the world of man intended as a catechism for the illiterate.

results.title: Romancing the Stone (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Michael Douglas, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, El Corazon Productions and Robert Zemeckis
results.brief_description: A best-selling romance writer, played by Kathleen Turner, gets more than bargained for when she goes to Colombia to find her kidnapped sister. There’s a mysterious man hanging around, the jungle is full of hungry crocodiles and the kidnappers are out to get her. Luckily a hero right out of her imagination (Michael Douglas) is there to rescue her…but for a price. This is a film that recalls the spirit of the old movie matinee serials.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Douglas, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, El Corazon Productions and Robert Zemeckis

results.title: Romancing the stone
results.creator_credit: Michael Douglas, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, El Corazon Productions and Robert Zemeckis
results.brief_description: Best-selling romance writer Joan Wilder (Kathleen Turner) specialises in stories replete with heroes in white, villains in black and damsels with heaving bosoms. For Joan however the reality is that she has a staid life without true adventures. All that changes when she receives a desperate call from her sister in South America who, having been kidnapped by mercenaries, is desperately in need of rescuing. Joan is in possession of a valuable treasure map, sought after by the police trailing her and the kidnappers who are holding her sister, both of who will stop at nothing to get it. Once in South America Joan falls in with soldier of fortune Jack Holton (Michael Douglas) who happens to be a handsome, dashing hero. Many films followed in the wake of “Raiders of the lost ark”, hoping to mimic the success of that film, but few films managed, as successfully as this one does, to capture the same energy and sense of rollicking, great, Saturday afternoon matinee fun.

results.title: Romance on the high seas = It's magic
results.creator_credit: Alex Gottlieb, Warner Bros Pictures and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: Elvira and Michael Kent (Janis Paige and Don De Fore) are about to celebrate their third anniversary, however for the third year in a row, Michael can’t make it. Elvira has always suspected her husband of being a philanderer, so decides to tell her husband that she’s going away on their anniversary cruise to South America without him, while secretly staying behind and spying on him from an apartment opposite his work. When there’s a mix up at the drugstore between Elvira’s passport and that of nightclub singer Georgia Garrett (Doris Day), the plan begins to take shape. Georgia has never travelled before, and jumps at the opportunity to take an all expenses paid cruise; the only hitch is she has to pretend she’s Lady Elvira Kent. Michael is as suspicious as his wife when it comes to fidelity, and he is surprised by her lack of concern about him not coming on the cruise. Instead of hiring someone to impersonate him, Michael hires personal detective Peter Virgil (Jack Carson) to go on the cruise and keep an eye on his wife. Peter and Georgia are drawn together and fall in love but are held back by their loyalty to the people who have hired them. The film culminates in the carnival city of Rio, where Georgia, Peter, the real Mr and Mrs Kent, and Georgia’s friend who wants to marry her are all in the same hotel, where all will be revealed. This was Doris Day’s first film role.

results.title: Romance of transportation
results.brief_description: A light-hearted, whimsical look at the way an effective transportation system has been developed in Canada, despite the difficulties of vast distances and natural obstacles. An animated film by skilled animator Colin Low.

results.title: Romance calling: the forgotten city
results.brief_description: Film tells of the discovery of Angkor Thom, “the forbidden city” in Indo China and of its previous civilisation, showing ruins of this now extinct city.
